intro: Nannoglottis yuennanensis, commonly known as the Yuennan bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
